', 'Bikhchandani, who studied at the premier Indian Institute of Management, Ahmedabad, is founder and executive vice chairman of Info Edge.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Serial investor Leonid Boguslavsky has made most of his fortune from venture capital investments.', 'One of his first investments was his bet on Russian search engine firm Yandex, on which he apparently made 400 times his initial money.  ', 'He was also an investor in Epam, RingCentral and Delivery Hero.', "He was a partner of Boris Berezovsky in a Russian-Italian joint venture LogoVAZ in the 1980's.  "]
abouts: ['Boguslavsky competed in his first triathlon at age 62.', 'In 2017 Boguslavsky cofounded Super League Triathlon.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Ludwig Theodor Braun owns 10% of the medical device company B. Braun Melsungen, which began in 1839 as a small pharmacy that sold herbal remedies.', 'His father, Ludwig Georg Braun, took the reins in 1977, when the company had just $24 million in annual sales (now around $8 billion).', 'Today, with 60,000 employees globally, B. Braun manufactures products ranging from infusion and injection solutions to surgical instruments.']
abouts: ['A sixth-generation family member, Ludwig Theodor is the youngest son of Ludwig Georg.', 'B. Braun has been operating in Africa for more than 60 years, and now has subsidiaries in Zambia, Algeria, South Africa, Zimbabwe and Kenya.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Matthew Calkins is the cofounder and CEO of Appian, a software development service with over $175 million in revenue. ', 'Calkins cofounded the Reston, Virginia-based cloud computing company when he was 26. It went public on Nasdaq in May 2017.', "Nearly one third of Appian's 350 customers are on the Forbes Global list of the world's biggest companies.", 'Calkins is also a board game player and designer who has won at the World Boardgaming Championships.']
abouts: ['A game theory whiz, Calkins wrote a thesis at Dartmouth explaining when a losing hockey team should pull its goalie.']

name: Billionaires
title: Co-CEO
bios: ['Catz has served as co-CEO of software firm Oracle since September 2014, when founder Larry Ellison stepped down from the role.', "In 2017, Catz made $135 million in total realized pay, making her one of the world's highest paid female executives.", "She is credited with spearheading Oracle's aggressive acquisition strategy, helping close more than 130 acquisitions since 2005.", "A 19-year Oracle veteran, Catz is one of Ellison's closest confidants.", "Despite Catz's complaints to Trump that an RFP process favored Amazon, this fall he invited her to join the Presidential Intelligence Advisory Board."]
abouts: ["In 2006, Catz says she didn't want to be CEO of Oracle after Ellison.", "Catz served on President Donald Trump's transition team. ", 'Catz also serves on the board of The Walt Disney Co.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Chang chairs Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing, one of the world's largest manufacturers of semiconductors. ", 'His degrees from MIT are in mechanical engineering and his PhD is in electrical engineering.', 'Chang worked for a quarter-century at Texas Instruments and then joined the Taiwan research body that spun off TSMC.', 'TSMC customers include Apple, Nvidia and Qualcomm.']
abouts:
['Chang founded TSMC in 1987; a decade later the company became the first Taiwanese firm to trade on the New York Stock Exchange.

']

name: Billionaires
bios:
['Chen Zhuolin is the chairman and founder of real estate developer Agile Group.
', 'Chen founded Agile Group in 1992.
', 'He started out in business by creating Dynasty Furniture in Guangdong Province in 1985.', 'Agile Group listed at Hong Kong Stock Exchange in 2005.
', 'Chen has donated more than $7 million to Hainan Tropical Ocean University. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Richard Desmond founded Northern & Shell, which published the Daily Express newspapers, OK! and Star magazines, and operates UK's Health Lottery.", 'He was raised by his secretary mom in a garage apartment -- his parents divorced after his dad, an advertising executive, gambled away their savings.', "Desmond started his first magazine, International Musician, at age 22 with a $60,000 loan, then became Penthouse's U.K. licensee. ", 'He expanded to titles like Asian Babes and Posh Housewives, then sold some holdings and went mass market, launching OK! and buying Express Newspapers.', "In February 2018 he sold N&S's publishing arm, including its newspaper and magazine titles, to rival Trinity Mirror for about $177 million."]
abouts: ['In 2003, Desmond created the band RD Crusaders with Roger Daltrey from The Who and other musicians.', "He quit school at age 14 to become a drummer, then dressed up in his older brother's suit to land a job selling newspaper ads over the phone a year later. "]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Marek Dospiva is cofounder of Penta Investments, which has investments in the healthcare, banking, real estate and aeronautical industries. ', 'Penta has controlling stakes in Privatbanka, pharmacy chain Dr. Max and sports betting operator Fortuna.  ', 'Dospiva and Slovak Jaroslav Hascak, who were both studying in Beijing, got started importing Chinese textiles to chain stores in Czechoslovakia.', "During Slovakia's 1996 privatization, Penta gained control over the nation's biggest fund paying only 20 percent of its real market value. ", 'Dospiva and Hascak are still both partners and the largest shareholders of Penta Investments. ']
abouts: ['Dospiva is developing an office building complex in Prague that was the last project of famous British architect Zaha Hadid, who died in 2016.', 'Dospiva, who speaks Chinese and likes sports car, is co-owner of Ferrari and Maserati dealerships in the Czech Republic. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Du Sha is the chairman of Pacific Links International, a global golf club membership group. ', 'Du founded the HomeWorld Group in 1992, and built the company into two major retail chains with 97 superstores before selling them off.', 'Son Jeff runs a successful investment company in Beijing.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Charles Dunstone is chairman of TalkTalk Telecom and former chairman of electronics retailer Dixons Carphone, both based in the UK.', 'In 1989, Dunstone started Carphone Warehouse in his apartment with $12,000 in savings. In 2014, Carphone merged with Dixons, an electronics retailer. ', 'The move was seen as a bet on the growth of the Internet of Things, the increasing web-connectivity of home appliances and electronics.', 'He also founded TalkTalk, a spin-off from Carphone Warehouse, in 2002.']
abouts: ['Outside of the office, he is an avid yachtsman and participates in sailing regattas around the globe.', 'Dunstone was knighted in 2012.']

name: Billionaires
bios:
['Alexander Dzhaparidze started out buying outdated seismic facilities abroad in the 1990s and offering exploration services in Russia.
', 'Dzhaparidze founded service company Petroalliance, which he later sold to Schlumberger.', "He bought oil giant Lukoil's drilling subsidiary for $130 million in 2004 and turned it into Eurasia Drilling Company.
", 'In 2017 Eurasia Drilling announced that its shareholders agreed to sell 51% of the company to Schlumberger.
']
abouts: ['Dhaparidze collects ancient daggers. \r\n', "In 2016 Dhaparidze bought a yacht, which he renamed 'Here Comes the Sun' after The Beatles song."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Wolfgang Egger is founder and CEO of publicly traded real estate company Patrizia AG.', 'Based in Augsburg, Germany, it employs around 700 people across 15 countries and manages around $50 billion in real estate assets.', "Egger started Patrizia in 1984 and took it public in 2006. With more than 50%, he's still the biggest shareholder.", "Patrizia's portfolio comprises approximately 700 properties with more than 200 institutional investors."]
abouts: ['After starting out as a dental laboratory technician, Egger quickly realized his love for real estate and founded Patrizia at the age of 19.', 'He supports charitable social projects around the world through his Patrizia Kinderhaus-Stiftung.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["David Fattal is founder of the Fattal Hotel Chain, Israel's largest hotel organization.", 'Fattal got his start as a waiter and bellboy and rose through management ranks before starting Fattal Hotels in 1998 at age 41.', 'Fattal Hotels owns 36 hotels with 9,000 rooms in Israel. It manages more than 160 hotels across Europe, many in Germany.', "In February 2018, the hotel chain's parent company, Fattal Holdings 1998, went public on the Tel Aviv stock exchange.", "He owns more than 50% of the company's shares."]

name: Billionaires
title: Founder and Executive Chairman
employment: {'name': 'Ivanhoe Mines Ltd.', 'title': 'Founder and Executive Chairman', 'government': False}
bios: ['Robert Friedland founded and chairs Toronto-listed Ivanhoe Mines, a leader in the mining and precious metals industry.', 'Based in Singapore, Friedland is praised for finding profitable mines in remote areas like Oyu Tolgoi in Mongolia.', 'A graduate of Reed College, Friedland also funds Ivanhoe Capital Corporation, which invests in emerging markets.', 'He has a 12.7% stake in Australia-listed CleanTeQ Holdings, which supplies cobalt and nickel to lithium-ion battery producers.']
abouts: ["Friedland's son Govind is a geologist and founder of uranium mining outfit GoviEx Uranium.\r\n", 'Friedland owns Ivanhoe Pictures, a production company that merged with Sidney Kimmel Entertainment to form SK Global.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['William along with his brother Victor run Li & Fung, which operates as a middleman between global manufacturers and retailers in the U.S. and Europe.', 'The company works with some 15,000 factories in over 40 countries.', "As more brands have taken greater control of their supply chain by dealing directly with factories, the brothers' fortune has fallen in recent years.", 'William stepped down as chairman of Li & Fung in October 2020; his son Spencer was appointed to executive chairman that month. ', 'In May 2020 Li & Fung was privatized through a deal worth $930 million. ']
abouts: ["The brothers' grandfather, Fung Pak-liu, founded Li & Fung with partner Li To-ming in 1906, exporting porcelain and silk."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Gao Tianguo is the largest investor in Shanghai-listed AnXin Trust.  \r\n', 'Gao, who also goes by Ko Tin Kwok, also invests in real estate and energy. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Gao Yunfeng chairs Han's Laser Technology Industry Group, a supplier of laser-based products for industrial applications. ", "Han's Laser Technology was founded by Gao in 1996.", 'Gao holds an undergraduate degree in aircraft design from Beihang University and an MBA from Peking University.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['John Goff made a fortune selling his Crescent Real Estate to Morgan Stanley for $6.5 billion in 2007, just before the financial crisis.', 'With Barclays Plc., Goff bought it back at a steep discount after the market collapse ', 'When the joint venture ended in 2017, Goff regained full control of Crescent. ', "The real estate group's most prized asset is Canyon Ranch, the legendary wellness spa and resort founded near Tuscon, Ariz. ", "Crescent's new McKinney+Olive complex, designed by Cesar Pelli, earns the highest office rents in Dallas. "]
abouts: ['Goff got his big break working for famed Fort Worth investing guru Richard Rainwater. ', 'In 2017 Goff teamed with Cowboys owner Jerry Jones to acquire pro video gaming team Complexity Gaming. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Pedro Grendene Bartelle cofounded Grendene, one of the world's largest sandal manufacturers, with his twin brother Alexandre Grendene Bartelle.", 'Pedro is vice-chairman of the board of directors of Grendene SA. and owns just under 14% of Sao Paulo-listed Grendene SA.', 'He invests in other businesses, including footwear company Vulcabras Azaleia, a direct competitor to Grendene in which he holds a controlling stake.']
abouts: ['Pedro is married to Tania Bulhoes, a Brazilian entrepreneur who owns Tania Bulhoes Perfumes Ltda., a well known retailer of perfumes, creams and soaps.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Mimi Haas, the widow of former Levi Strauss & Co. CEO Peter Haas, owns a nearly 17% stake in the storied jeans company. ', "In February 2019, Levi's filed to go public, revealing Mimi as the largest shareholder among several Haas family members.", "Mimi Haas served as a board member at Levis Strauss from 2014 to 2018. Peter Haas Jr., Mimi's stepson, is currently a board member.", "Altogether six members of the Haas family, which ranks as one of America's richest clans, own a combined 63% of Levi's.", 'Bavarian immigrant Levi Strauss founded the company in San Francisco in 1853; he invented denim blue jeans in 1873.']

name: Billionaires
title: Cofounder and CEO
bios: ["David Hall is at the forefront of the self-driving car revolution with his LiDAR sensors that allow vehicles to see what's around them.", 'He first patented a LiDAR sensor in 2006 as part of a race for autonomous vehicles sponsored by the U.S. Department of Defense.', 'Hall, an engineer, founded Velodyne in 1983 as an audio equipment company, selling speakers with a patented sub-woofer starting at $2,000.']
abouts: ['Hall made a robot for a TV show called "Robot Wars" that finished second-place in the 2001 world championship.', "Hall's father was also an engineer and his grandfather was a physicist."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Ronnen Harary is the cofounder and co-CEO of Spin Master Corp., known for its popular kids' toys like Hatchimals, Air Hogs and Paw Patrol.  ", 'Harary started the company in 1994 with his childhood friend Anton Rabie.', 'Armed with $10,000, Rabie and Harary released Spin Master\'s first toy in 1994. It was called "Earth Buddy" and resembled a Chia Pet.', 'Spin Master had its IPO in 2015.  ', 'Spin Master is now a $1.2 billion (sales) company, which employs over 1,500 people in 16 countries.']
abouts: ['Rabie and Harary reportedly met at summer camp in Ontario when they were both 11 years old. ', "Spin Master made toys for the popular children's TV show, The Wiggles."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Jaroslav Hascak  is cofounder of Penta Investments, which has investments in the healthcare, banking, real estae and aeronautical industries. ', 'Penta, which he controls with Mark Dospiva, has controlling stakes in Privatbanka, pharmacy chain Dr. Max and sports betting operator Fortuna.  ', 'Hascak and Czech Dospiva, who were both studying in Beijing, got started importing Chinese textiles to chain stores in Czechoslovakia.  ', "During Slovakia's 1996 privatization, Penta gained control over the nation's biggest fund paying only 20 percent of its real market value. ", 'A very hands-on manager, he has created very competitive culture within the company, called System Up or Out, designed to get rid of weak performers.']
abouts: ['Hascak spent one-tenth of his early earnings to buy his first car, a Fiat Uno; the rest he invested into the stock brokerage business. ', 'Hascak typically works 12 hours a day, six days a week. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['He Zhaoxi is the chairman of Sangfor Technologies, a supplier of IT infrastructure solutions.', 'The company went public on the Shenzhen Stock Exchange in 2018.', 'He graduated from China University of Science and Technology in 1998 with a degree in automatic control and economic management.', 'After his graduation, Mr. He worked for Huawei Technologies from 1998 to 2000. ', 'He cofounded Sangfor Technologies in 2000.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Donald R. Horton founded homebuilder D.R. Horton in 1978 and took it public in 1992; he owns about 6% of the company.', 'D.R. Horton had $13.7 billion in revenues in the fiscal year through September 2017.', "Horton studied to be a pharmacist at Oklahoma University but joined his father's real estate brokerage before founding D.R. Horton.", 'His company built its first neighborhood in the Dallas/Ft. Worth area and then expanded across the U.S.', 'Donald Horton appeared on The Forbes 400 in 2005 ranked No. 235, with a net worth of $1.4 billion. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Huang Hongyun chairs Jinke Property Group, one of the largest real estate developers in the central China city of Chongqing.\r\n', 'Huang holds an executive MBA from Chongqing University and enjoys hiking.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Huang Qisen chairs the Tahoe Group, a real estate developer and chemical manufacturer.', "Huang holds a bachelor's degree from Fuzhou University in China."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Masayuki Ishihara and his immediate family own about 45% of Tokyo-listed pachinko machine maker Heiwa.', 'Ishihara is not involved in running Heiwa.', 'He founded another pachinko firm, Olympia, which Heiwa acquired in a stock swap in 2007.', "Heiwa subsidiary PGM is one of Japan's largest golf course operators."]

name: Billionaires
title: Founder
bios: ['At 21, celebrity-turned-makeup mogul Kylie Jenner - a member of the Kardashian-Jenner clan - is the youngest self-made billionaire ever.', 'Jenner, who started out peddling $29 lip kits in 2015, sold an estimated $360 million worth of Kylie Cosmetics in 2018.', 'In November 2018, Jenner launched a distribution deal with beauty retailer Ulta and sold an estimated $55 million of product in just 6 weeks.', 'Thanks to its super low overhead and massive sales, the company is worth at least $900 million. Jenner owns a 100% stake.', 'Jenner, who comes from a wealthy family, has leveraged her 177 million social media followers to create her own billion-dollar fortune.', 'She used $250,000 of her earnings from modeling gigs to pay an outside company to produce her first 15,000 lip kits.']
abouts: ['At age 17, two years before starting the business, Jenner trademarked the phrase "Kylie Lip Kits ... For the perfect pout."', "Her family's reality TV show, Keeping up with the Kardashians, premiered when she was just 10 years old."]

name: Billionaires
title: Actor
bios: ["Jiang Xuefei is the chairman of Shenzhen Suntak Circuit Technology, one of China's largest makers of printed circuit boards.\r\n", 'Jiang holds an EMBA from Xiamen University.\r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Johan Johannson and his family own nearly 75% of NorgesGruppen, the Norwegian grocery store chain he inherited from his father and uncle.', 'His father still oversees the company as chairman of the board; Jahon has no role in running the business.', 'The company has been family run since it was founded in 1866.', 'Norgesgruppen has more than 1,850 grocery stores and 650 convenience stores and nearly 40% market share in Norway.']
abouts: ['In 2012 the company vowed to reduce sugar sales by 10% by promoting more healthy alternatives. Between 2012 and 2017, sales of fruits and vegetables were up 28%.', 'Johan Johannson is one of four competing Norwegian grocery billionaires; the others are Odd Reitan, Stein Erik Hagen and his daughter Caroline Hagen Kjos.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['David Kabiller is cofounder of AQR, a money management firm that trades assets through a systematic, research-driven approach.', 'The firm focuses on traditional and alternative investment strategies and has $200 billion of assets under management.', 'Based in Greenwich, Connecticut, AQR operates globally with 1,000 employees working in offices from London to Sydney and Hong Kong.', 'Before AQR, he was a vice president at Goldman Sachs, working with chief investment officers of large pension and endowment funds in North America.']
abouts: ['Kabiller founded the Kabiller Prize and the Kabiller Young Investigator Award for researchers in nanoscience and nanomedicine at Northwestern University.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Along with family, Chatchai Kaewbootta owns 49% of finance firm Srisawad, one of Thailand's largest providers of loans against motorcycles and cars.", 'Srisawad has more than 2,800 branches and a fast-expanding business of providing nano-finance loans of under $2,800. ', 'Son of a tractor distributor, he joined the family trade then went on to become a dealer for Honda motorcycles.\r\n', 'Chatchai started the business in 1984, sold to AIG in 2007, but got back into into the same business with a new name in 2009.\r\n']
abouts: ['Srisawad\'s service slogan is "Mee Baan Mee Rod Ngern Sod Than Jai," which translates to "Your car and/or your home can bring you instant cash."', 'Chatchai named the company after his mother.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Morris Kahn cofounded Amdocs, a customer-relationship management-and-billing software firm for large telecom outfits. ', 'He sold nearly $1 billion worth of shares after Admocs went public in 1998.', 'A South African native, he lives on the Israeli coast and spends most of his time on a 100-foot yacht.', 'Through his Aurum Ventures, Morris invests in life sciences and clean-tech companies that he hopes will contribute to the wellbeing of the planet.', 'He cofounded Coral World International, which had built aquariums in locations such as the Bahamas and Australia. ']
abouts: ['An avid diver, Kahn started building aquariums after a diving accident that gave him a burst eardrum, forcing him to stay on land for months. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Ingvar Kamprad, who died in 2018, transferred the bulk of his Ikea empire to foundations in the 80's, but kept enough to make his sons billionaires.", "Jonas and his brothers own Ikano Group, which was created to manage Ikea's real estate and financial service businesses, but was spun out in 1988.", 'Today Ikano Group is a $9.1 billion (sales) company with interests in banking, real estate and Asian shopping centers.', 'Jonas, the middle child, studied industrial and furniture design in Switzerland and applied his skills in Ikea-run subsidiary Habitat.', 'He is a board member of Netherlands-based Ikea parent Stichting INGKA Foundation and Ikano Group.']
abouts: ['Ingvar Kamprad ranked among the top 10 richest people for years before lawyers produced documents proving that he had irrevocably transferred economic control.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Ingvar Kamprad, who died in 2018, transferred the bulk of his Ikea empire to foundations in the 80's, but kept enough to make his sons billionaires.", "Mathias and his brothers own Ikano Group, which was created to manage Ikea's real estate and financial service businesses, but was spun out in 1988.", 'Today Ikano Group is a $9.1 billion (sales) company with interests in banking, real estate and Asian shopping centers.', 'Mathias, the youngest brother, is a board member of Inter Ikea Holding, the owner of the intellectual property assets.', 'He sits on the board of Ikano Group, and on the supervisory board of Interogo, a Liechtenstein-based foundation that is the ultimate owner of Ikea.']
abouts: ["Mathias put in two years as assistant to Ikea's founder, Ingvar Kamprad, ranked among the top 10 richest people in the world for five years.", "Ingvar Kamprad's net worth took a slide in 2011 after his lawyers produced documents proving that he had irrevocably transferred economic control decades earlier."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Ingvar Kamprad, who died in 2018, transferred the bulk of his Ikea empire to foundations in the 80's, but kept enough to make his sons billionaires.", "Peter and his brothers own Ikano Group, which was created to manage Ikea's real estate and financial service businesses, but was spun out in 1988.", 'Today Ikano Group is a $9.1 billion (sales) company with interests in banking, real estate and Asian shopping centers.', "Peter, the eldest brother, ran Ikea's Belgian operations for 12 years; he now chairs the Ikano Group.", 'Early in his career, Peter worked three years at a different Swedish retail giant, fast-fashion company H&M.']
abouts: ['Ingvar Kamprad ranked among the top 10 richest people for years before lawyers produced documents proving that he had irrevocably transferred economic control.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Kasprzak, along with his sister Anna and mother Hanni, owns $1.46 billion (sales) Danish shoe manufacturer, ECCO.', "ECCO's products are sold in 90 countries from more than 2,200 ECCO shops and online.", "ECCO was founded by Kasprzak's late grandfather, Karl Toosbuy, in 1963.", "He joined ECCO's supervisory board in 2017 after his father, Dieter, stepped down as CEO.", 'Kasprzak previously served in the Danish military and played professional golf in the Nordic League.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Kasprzak, along with her brother André and mother Hanni, owns $1.46 billion (sales) Danish shoe manufacturer, ECCO.', "ECCO's products are sold in 90 countries from more than 2,200 ECCO shops and online.", "ECCO was founded by Kasprzak's late grandfather, Karl Toosbuy, in 1963.", 'She is a dressage rider and competed in the 2016 Olympics in Rio de Janeiro, placing 14th.', 'Kasprzak operates a private dressage barn in Haderslev.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Michael Kim helped start MBK Partners, the private-equity firm that bears his initials and manages more than $15 billion in assets. ', 'His ING Insurance Korea, which went public in 2017, was the first company wholly owned by a private equity firm to list on the Korean exchange. ', "In September 2016 his firm's $6.1 billion takeover of Tesco's Korean operation, Homeplus, marked the country's biggest private-equity deal to date. "]
abouts: ['He is married to Park Kyung-Ah, daughter of the late Prime Minister Park Tae-Joon who was part of the inner circle of former President Park Chung-Hee.', 'Kim is a former executive of Caryle Group, where he led Asia operations for six years. He cofounded MBK in 2005 with five executives from Carlyle. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Leo Koguan is the cofounder and chairman of $10 billion (sales) IT provider SHI International, which has over 15,000 customers, like Boeing and AT&T', 'Koguan and his then-wife Thai Lee paid less than $1 million for a software reseller in 1989, the predecessor to SHI. ', "He has left the management of the company to Lee, the company's longstanding CEO and majority shareholder.", 'The Indonesian-born, Columbia-educated lawyer is a visiting professor at several universities in China.', 'The law school at Shanghai Jiao Tong University in China was named after him in 2008 after he pledged $30 million.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Koo Bon-neung is the chairman of Heesung Electronics, which makes display components for TVs, computers, tablets and smartphones. ', 'He is the younger brother of Koo Bon-moo, the late chairman of the LG Group, one of the top five conglomerates in South Korea. ', "In 2004 his son Koo Kwang-moo was adopted by his brother who lost his own son in a car accident. Kwang-moo is now LG's heir-apparent. "]
abouts: ['Koo is a former president of the Korea Baseball Organization. ', "He started his career in LG in 1976, as a manager for the company's branch in Chicago."]

name: Billionaires
title: Cofounder and CEO
bios: ["In 1984, Guy Laliberté, a former street performer, cofounded Cirque du Soleil, which would become one of the world's biggest entertainment companies.", 'His empire began with a show, funded by $1 million from the Canadian government, put on for the 450th anniversary of the discovery of Canada.', 'The celebration went global, and the shows have been performed for more than 180 million spectators across more than 400 cities on six continents.', ' In 2015 he sold much of his 90% stake to U.S. private equity firm TPG Capital and Chinese investment group Fosun, keeping 10% of the company.', 'In 2017, he founded Lune Rouge, which develops and invests in projects in arts, technology and entertainment.\r\n']
abouts: ['Guy Laliberté was the first private Canadian citizen to explore space as part of a 2009 mission to raise awareness on water issues facing humankind.', 'In 2007, Guy Laliberté founded One Drop, a foundation devoted to making clean and safe water accessible around the world.\r\n']

name: Billionaires
title: Founder
bios: ["After a stint at Goldman Sachs' risk arbitrage department, Edward Lampert founded hedge fund ESL Investments in 1988, betting on undervalued stocks.", 'He took over as CEO of struggling retail giant Sears Holdings (Sears, Kmart, Kenmore) in 2013 with hopes of a turnaround, but failed miserably. ', "Lampert's ESL Investments promised Sears nearly $1 billion in loans in the first 10 months of 2017.", 'In October 2018, Sears Holdings filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy and announced that it would close 142 Sears and Kmart stores.', 'In January 2019 Lampert won an auction to keep the company, with a reported bid of more than $5 billion; a judge still must sign off on the proposal. ']
abouts: ['Lampert was kidnapped in 2003. He was released by his captors after two days. ', 'A graduate of Yale University, he was a part of the secret society Skull and Bones, whose alumni include former presidents George H.W. Bush and George W. Bush. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Lee Sang-hyuk is the founder of the country's second-biggest unicorn, Yello Mobile. ", 'Launched in 2012, Yello operates as a tech incubator by growing and investing in young mobile-based startups. ', 'His company has been valued at $4 billion by investors; his ownership is just over 26%. ']
abouts: ['Lee worked as an executive for Korean search engine Daum for a year-and-a-half before leaving in 2013.', 'Yello Mobile has a portfolio of more than 80 companies across shopping, media, advertising and travel.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Li Guangyu chairs China Yuhua Education, whose private schools educate nearly 50,000 students in China.', 'Zhengzhou-headquartered Yuhua provides education from kindergarten to college at 16 campuses.', 'Li set up his first school in 2001 after operating a trading company.', 'Li graduated from the Changchun Institute of Optics and Fine Mechanics, majoring in laser technology, in 1983. \r\n', 'He holds an MBA from the Guanghua School of Management at Peking University.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Li Li is the vice chairman of Shenzhen-listed Aier Eye Hospital Group.', 'Aier Eye Hospital Group was founded in 2002 and is headquartered in the central Chinese city of Changsha. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['John Liew is co-founder of AQR, a money management firm that trades through a systematic, data-driven approach.', 'The firm focuses on traditional and alternative investment strategies and has $200 billion of assets under management.', 'Based in Greenwich, Connecticut, AQR operates globally with 1,000 employees working in offices from London to Sydney and Hong Kong.', 'Before cofounding AQR, Liew worked at Goldman Sachs as a portfolio manager, where he developed and managed quantitative trading strategies.', "He created the Liew College Fellows Fund to finance undergraduates who have unpaid research opportunities with the University of Chicago's faculty."]

name: Billionaires
bios:
['Lv is the founder of the Jilin Yongda Group, a supplier of magnetic switches.', ' Lv worked for state-owned Petrochina before he founded the predecessor to Yongda in 1986.
']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Ma Yunsheng chairs Chambroad Holding, a supplier of petrochemicals, fine chemicals and agribusiness products.', 'Ma worked as a government official before he joined Chambroad in 1982 when it was a collective.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Bernardo Matte Larrain inherited what is today Chile's largest pulp and paper producer, Empresas CMPC, from his father, Eliodoro Matte Ossa.", 'His siblings, Patricia Matte and Eliodoro Matte, also inherited a stake. ', 'They also own stakes in telecom, banking and shipping firms.', "Bernardo oversees the family's other assets, including its stake in financial firm Bicecorp, of which he is president, and electric utility Colbun.", 'In 2014, Bernardo left his position on the board of Colbun to focus on CMPC and Entel, a telecom company in which his family also holds an interest.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Eliodoro Matte inherited a stake in CMPC, a Chilean forestry and paper products company, from his father, Eliodoro Matte Ossa, who died in 2000.', "Until May 2011, Eliodoro was president of five of Grupo CMPC's holdings.", 'Despite having stepped down, he maintains leadership over Empresas CMPC, the primary holding company.', 'The siblings also have stakes in telecom, banking and shipping firms. ', 'Eliodoro served as president of conservative Chilean think tank Public Studies Center until 2015.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Lőrinc Mészáros founded a small gas-fitting company in Felcsút, the hometown of Prime Minister Viktor Orbán, in 1990. ', 'Orban, who founded the Ferenc Puskas Football Academy, tapped Meszaros to be its president.\r\n', 'Mészáros gas-fitting company, Mészáros & Mészáros Ltd, is now a big player in the construction market thanks to contracts from the government.   ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Poland\'s "King of Shoes," Dariusz Milek created CCC, the second biggest footwear retailer in Europe.', 'The CCC chain, which went public in 2004, has 1181 shops in 18 countries.', 'In 2018 Miłek took over the number two shoe company in Switzerland and formed a joint venture with a German footwear retailer.', 'CCC also sells shoes online in 15 EU markets through eobuwie.pl.', "Milek was a member of Poland's national youth cycling team and now owns CCC Cycling Group."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Lowell Milken is the younger brother and the former right-hand man of former financier Michael Milken.', 'Mike Milken expanded the market for high-yield junk bonds while at investment bank Drexel Burnham Lambert in the 1980s. \r\n', 'Lowell is the chairman and partial owner of Heron International, a London-based real estate firm that develops, invests in and manages properties.', 'He cofounded education firm Knowledge Universe in the mid 1990s.', 'In 2015, Knowledge Universe sold its early childhood education business to private equity firm Partners Group for an undisclosed sum.\r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Neilson is the ex-wife of billionaire Kerr Neilson and is also a billionaire. She's reported to have her own property portfolio.", 'She holds a stake in international equities manager Platinum Asset Management, founded in 1994 by her former husband.', "The Zimbabwe-born former graphic designer is founder and director of Sydney's White Rabbit Gallery.", "The gallery showcases one of the world's biggest collections of contemporary Chinese art post-2000.", 'She kickstarted another Sydney art gallery and a performance space called Phoenix.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Ni Zugen is chairman of home appliance maker Kingclean Electronic, which sells wares under the Lexy brand.', 'Ni worked for  a Suzhou-base vacuum cleaner factory before he founded his own business in 1994.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["With partner Andrei Klyamko, Vadim Novinsky owns Ukraine's Smart Holding Group, which has a 24% stake in Rinat Akhmetov's iron ore producer Metinvest.", 'Novinsky started working in Ukraine in the mid 1990s with oil producer Lukoil, then began buying Ukrainian metallurgy companies.', 'He united his companies in 2006 into Smart Holding Group, and in 2007 exchanged them for a stake in Metinvest.']
abouts: ["The Russian native got his Ukrainian citizenship in 2012, and became member of parliament in ex-prime minister Yanukovich's Party of Regions.", 'His wife and four children are all Russian citizens and live in St. Petersburg, Russia.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Kenny Park, who also goes by Park Eun-Kwan, is the founder and chief executive of Simone Accessory, a manufacturer of handbags and other accessories.', "Simone's customers include Donna Karan, Michael Kors, Kate Spade, Coach, Marc Jacobs, Alexander Wang, Versus Versace and AllSaints.", 'With factories in Vietnam, Cambodia, Indonesia and China, Simone produces some 30 million handbags and small leather goods every year. ', "After graduating from Yonsei University, Park joined his father's fishing company before landing a job at handbag manufacturer Chungsan and eventually striking out on his own in 1987.", "Park's daughter, Joowon, heads subsidiary Simone Fashion Co., which runs stores for German designer Karl Lagerfeld and Simone's own brand 0914."]
abouts: ["Simone is named after Park's wife's nickname; His label 0914 is the day in 1984 when Park and his college sweetheart, now his wife, reunited in a cafe.", "Park's Simone Handbag Museum in Seoul features a gallery of 350 accessories. It is housed in a building shaped like a handbag."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Anton Rabie is the cofounder and co-CEO of Spin Master Corp., known for its popular kids' toys like Hatchimals, Air Hogs and Paw Patrol. ", 'Rabie started the company in 1994 with childhood friend Ronnen Harary. ', 'Armed with $10,000, Rabie and Harary released Spin Master\'s first toy in 1994. It was called "Earth Buddy" and resembled a Chia Pet.', 'Spin Master had its IPO in 2015.  ', 'Spin Master is now a $1.2 billion (sales) company, which employs over 1,500 people in 16 countries.']
abouts: ['Rabie and Harary reportedly met at summer camp in Ontario when they were both 11 years old. \r\n', "Spin Master made toys for the popular children's TV show, The Wiggles."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Carolyn Rafaelian's fortune comes largely from her majority stake in spiritual bangle brand Alex and Ani, which she founded in 2004.", 'Alex and Ani, named after her two older daughters, has over 100 company-owned locations across North and South America. It also sells online. ', 'Granddaughter of Armenian immigrants, her father made American flag pins and costume jewelry in a Rhode Island factory where she now makes pieces.', 'Rafaelian has bought up more than 30 properties, most of which are in her native Rhode Island and include a castle and vineyard. ', 'She is an investor in Big3, a 3-on-3 basketball league made up primarily of former NBA players; it was cofounded by rapper and actor Ice Cube.']
abouts: ["Rafaelian's a big believer in the power of positive energy. She has a priest and shaman bless her inventory before it goes on sale.", "Rafaelian owns Belcourt, a 56,000-square foot Gilded Age mansion in Newport, R.I. once inhabited by suffragist Alva Vanderbilt, which she's renovating as a museum.\r\n"]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Alan Rydge is chairman and lead shareholder of cinema, hotel and ski-resort group Event Hospitality & Entertainment, formerly Amalgamated Holdings.', 'He inherited the Greater Union cinema chain after his father died in 1980. ', "He's also chairman and the major shareholder of equities investment company Carlton Investments."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Evan Sharp is cofounder and chief creative officer of visual bookmarking site Pinterest. ', "Sharp met Ben Silbermann, Pinterest CEO and fellow cofounder, through a mutual friend while in Columbia University's architecture program. ", 'Each month, 175 million people use Pinterest to collect and post images related to fashion, travel, cooking and other interests. ', 'Pinterest raised $150 million in venture funding in June 2017, with investors valuing the company at $12.3 billion. ']
abouts: ['Sharp was an avid ultimate frisbee player during his time at the University of Chicago. ', 'Over the years, Sharp has collected rocks, coins, pencils, stickers and, as an architecture student, images, renderings and photographs. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Mikhail Shelkov is the former head of the investment division of state-owned Rostec, which controlled military contractors in Russia.', "Shelkov's former boss Sergey Chemezov, CEO of Rostec, is a member of Putin's inner circle, befriending Russia's president in Germany in the 1980s. ", 'From 2012 to 2014, Shelkov and partners bought a controlling stake in VSMPO-AVISMA Corporation from Rostec and Gazprombank.', "VSMPO-AVISMA is the world's largest titanium producer for the aerospace industry, with such customers as Boeing, Airbus, Rolls-Royce and Embraer. \r\n"]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Shin Dong-joo is the eldest son of Shin Kyuk-Ho, who founded Lotte Group, South Korea's fifth largest conglomerate. ", "Lotte Group is South Korea's largest retailer and has interests ranging from food and beverages to chemicals, construction and professional baseball. ", 'In early 2015 Shin Dong-joo was dismissed from his executive positions in the group after a bitter feud with his brother Dong-Bin. ', 'In February 2018 Dong-bin was sentenced to 30 months in prison surrounding a bribery case that involved former president Park Geun-hye who is now jail']
abouts: ['Lotte started as a confectionery manufacturer in Japan in 1948 and expanded into South Korea in 1967. ', 'At the start of his career he worked for Mitsubishi in Japan in 1978.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['In the early 1990s Zakhar Smuskhin and his business partner Boris Zingarevich were active in barter trading with Russian pulp and paper mills.', 'Later in the 1990s, during the privatization phase in Russia, they bought their first plant, the Kotlas pulp and paper mill.', "The partners' Ilim Group formed a joint venture in 2007 with multinational firm International Paper; the venture operates in Russia as Ilim Group.", 'As part of the deal, International Paper purchased 50% of Ilim for approximately $650 million.', 'Smushkin also owns about 9,900 acres of land near Saint Petersburg.']
abouts: [" Russia's prime minister and former president, Dmitry Medvedev, worked as general counsel of Ilim Holding in the mid 1990s.", 'Smuskhin collects Russian paintings, particularly works by Mikhail Vrubel.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Make-up mogul Anastasia Soare has made a fortune applying the golden ratio--used by the ancient Greeks and Leonardo da Vinci--to eyebrows.\r\n', 'Born in Romania, she immigrated to Los Angeles in 1989 and got a job in a beauty salon.', 'Three years later, she struck out on her own, and in 2000, she launched a line of eyebrow products under the name Anastasia Beverly Hills.', "Sales took off after her daughter Claudia, who is the company's president, began promoting the brand on Instagram. ", 'The company now sells more than 480 products in over 3,000 stores; revenues are estimated at more than $200 million.\r\n']
abouts: ['Soare is a favorite of the celebrity set. Her first clients included Cindy Crawford and Naomi Campbell, and she now does the brows of the Kardashians.\r\n', "When she came to America, Soare spoke little English and couldn't get approval for a credit card.\r\n"]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Real estate billionaire Axel Stawski founded Stawski Partners in 1973. ', 'The company owns six office buildings and three condos in Manhattan.', "He is developing two luxury residential towers in Queens' Long Island City, his first developments in about a decade.", 'Stawski was born in post-war Germany to Jewish parents who both survived the Holocaust.', 'He immigrated to America in 1971 to attend New York University.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Diamond tycoon Beny Steinmetz is owner of BSGR, an embattled mining company with a presence in Guinea and Sierra Leone.', 'BSGR is under investigation in several countries, including the U.S. for violating the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act. The company denies the claims.', "In 2010, BSGR sold 51% of its mining rights in Guinea to Brazil's multinational Vale for $2.5 billion. As of 2016 it had only collected $500 million.", 'After determining that BSGR had obtained rights to Guinean iron mines illegally, in 2014 the Guinean government denied BSGR access to mines there. ', 'In April 2017, he sued billionaire George Soros for $10 billion, accusing Soros of perpetrating a smear campaign. Soros denies the allegations. ']
abouts: ['Born and raised in Israel, Steinmetz moved to Belgium in 1978 to start Steinmetz Diamond Group with his brother.', 'BSGR subsidiary Koidu Limited supplied Tiffany & Co. with rough diamonds from its mine in Sierra Leone until March 2017.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Sun Mengquan chairs Shandong-based cooking oil company Luhua Group.', 'Sun began working for the predecessor of Luhua in 1983, when it was a nearly bankrupt metals-trading collective with fewer than 10 workers. ', "Sun shifted the company's business to processing and exporting peanuts, and, later, into peanut oil."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Sun Yinhuan controls Yida China Holdings, a leading operator of business parks in China.', 'Sun is a vice president of the China Real Estate Association and vice chairman of the All-China Federation of Industry & Commerce.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['James Truchard cofounded National Instruments, a supplier of testing and measurement equipment and software for scientists and engineers, in 1976.', 'A Texas native, he got a PhD in electrical engineering from the University of Texas, Austin in 1974.', "He launched National Instruments while working as managing director of the acoustical measurements division at the university's applied research lab.", 'The company produces both hardware and software for governments, colleges and companies, including Subaru and Airbus.', "In January 2019, Truchard retired as chairman of National Instuments' board."]
abouts: ['A gardening and photography enthusiast, Truchard published "Memories from a Hill Country Garden: Flowers, Stones, and Critters" in 2013.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Low-profile tycoon Surin Upatkoon made his fortune across sectors ranging from telecom to gaming to insurance.', 'Most of his fortune comes from selling a 10% stake in Thai telecom company InTouch in 2013. ', 'He owns stakes in listed gaming company Magnum Corp, textile firm MWE and insurance-and-property company MPHB Capital.', 'He started his career as a manager at MWE Weaving in 1971 and rose through the ranks.', 'His son, Krian, is on the textile company board while Ivevei, the older of his two daughters, is on the board of the financial-services company.']
abouts: ['Upatkoon is a Thai national but moved to Penang for school, stayed for work and has been a  Malaysia resident ever since.  ', 'He loves playing golf.']

name: Billionaires
title: Investor
bios: ['Alexander Vik comes from a wealthy family of fur merchants and has dabbled in everything from closed-end country funds to insurance and tech startups.', 'He remains locked in a contentious legal battle with Deutsche Bank, which in late 2013 obtained a $250 million judgment against his trading operation.', "Deutsche had sued the trading operation, based largely out of Vik's Connecticut home, over a margin call that went unpaid during the financial crisis.", "So far Vik is not paying and has appealed the London court's judgment.", "Meanwhile Deutsche has started legal proceedings in New York, Connecticut, Delaware and Oslo to investigate Vik's assets."]
abouts: ['A Norwegian who was raised in Sweden and schooled in the Canary Islands, Vik was a former golf champion at Harvard University.', 'During the first Internet bubble, Vik was behind Xcelera.com, one of the biggest dot.com boom and bust stocks of the era.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Wang Junjin chairs Juneyao Group, which controls Shanghai-listed Juneyao Airlines.', 'Wang holds an EMBA from Cheung Kong Graduate School of Business.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Wang Muqing is the founder of China ZhengTong Auto Services Holdings, which has car dealerships throughout China. ', 'ZhengTong specializes in luxury automobiles.', 'Wang started out in the auto trading business in 1996.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Wang Zhenghua is president of Spring Airlines of China, one of the world's largest budget carriers. ", 'Wang was a district government official in Shanghai before he set up his first company, Shanghai Spring Tour, in 1981.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Prem Watsa founded Toronto-based financial services firm Fairfax Financial Holdings in 1985 and remains its chairman and CEO.', "Born in Hyderabad, India, Watsa later joined his brother in Canada, and then enrolled in the University of Western Ontario's MBA program.", 'He paid his way through school by selling appliances door-to-door and, after a stint as an investment analyst, struck out on his own in 1984.', 'He began acquiring insurance companies, modeling his business after the success of his idol, Warren Buffett.', 'Fairfax now has property and casualty insurance and reinsurance interests across the world plus stakes in companies that include BlackBerry and GE.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Sanford "Sandy" Weill spent decades in financial services, culminating with Travelers and Citicorp merging to form Citigroup in 1998.', "Weill's first job was a Bear Stearns runner in 1955, earning $150 a week. ", 'He formed a brokerage firm with partners, built it into Shearson Loeb Rhoads, and sold it to American Express for nearly $1 billion in 1981. ', 'Weill was CEO of Citigroup until 2003 and chairman until 2006.', ' He is still an active investor, president of the board of trustees at Carnegie Hall and on the executive council at UC San Francisco. ']
abouts: ['When Weill first got married, he and his wife lived with her parents.', "Weill's protege at Travelers and Citigroup was Jamie Dimon, who left in 2000 to be CEO of Bank One (now JP Morgan Chase). \r\n"]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Wong Hong King is the controlling shareholder of Hong Kong-listed LVGEM China Real Estate Investment. ', "LVGEM was founded in 1995. Wong's daughter is chairman and his son is executive director. "]

name: Billionaires
bios:
['Wu is the chairman of central Taiwan auto-parts-maker Fine Blanking.
', 'Most of his fortune comes from the 2007 sale of a stake he owned in Hong Kong-listed beverage-and instant-noodle-maker Tingyi.', 'Also known as Tony.']

name: Billionaires
title: Entrepreneur
bios: ['Wu Yiling chairs Yiling Pharmaceutical, which makes cardiovascular and flu drugs, among others. ', 'Wu, whose father was a doctor, practiced Chinese medicine for 11 years himself before he founded Yiling Pharmaceutical in 1992. \r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios:
['Vadim Yakunin founded Protek Center of Implementation in 1990.', 'Protek, which went public in 2010 and now has $4 billion in revenues, is one of the biggest drug distributors in Russia.
', 'Yakunin, who got his start importing computers and writing software, also worked in the tourist business in Hungary.', 'While in Hungary, he met reps from a large pharmaceutical firm and decided to start importing drugs. ', 'Later he founded the Rigla chain of drug stores, and built a pharmaceutical factory and logistics center near Moscow.']
abouts: ["Sister Yuliya Yakunina is economic director of Protek and a member of Protek's board since 2002.", 'Yakunin graduated from the Moscow Physical and Technical Institute (MIPT) as engineer-physicist. He holds a degree as a Doctor of Technical Sciences.\r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Yan Yude is a director of Virscend Education, a provider of K-12 private education services in China.', 'Yan obtained a certificate for postgraduate studies in criminology from the Sichuan University in July 1999.', "Yan's wife Wang Xiaoying chairs Virscend Education."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Yang Keng chairs Shanghai-listed Sichuan Languang Development, one of the largest real estate companies in western China.\r\n', 'Yang started an auto parts company in 1989 before he entered the real estate business in 1993.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Yang Tingdong's fortune comes from a stake in rice-wine supplier Jiangsu Yanghe Brewery.", 'Yang chaired the company from 2002 to 2012.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Yu Rong chairs Meinian Onehealth Healthcare Holdings, which offers health exams throughout China.', "Yu holds a doctor's degree of China Academy of Chinese Medical Sciences and an EMBA of China Europe International Business School."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Zhu Wenchen chairs Furen Pharmaceutical Group Industry, a pharmaceuticals supplier.', 'Zhu cofounded the predecessor to Furen in 1997.', 'Zhu took control of Shanghai-listed Shanghai Minfeng Industrial Group in January 2006 and changed its name to Furen Pharmaceutical Group Industry.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['In the early 1990s Boris Zingarevich and his business partner Zakhar Smuskhin got involved in barter trading with Russian pulp and paper mills.', "Later that decade, during the country's privatization phase, they bought their first plant, the Kotlas pulp and paper mill.", "The partners' Ilim Group formed a joint venture in 2007 with multinational firm International Paper; the venture operates in Russia as Ilim Group.", 'As part of the deal, International Paper purchased 50% of Ilim for approximately $650 million, most of which was cash.', 'Zingarevich also controls Ilim Timber, a large Russian processed timber firm.']
